titleInfo.title: WAS brought to the City Police Jail.

mods.abstract: WAS brought to the City Police Jail on the 31st of December, 1861, the black boy LASS. Says he belongs to Mr. John Minor, who lives on Fairview plantation, parish of Plaquemines, La. He is 5 feet 7 1/2 inches high, looks rather stupid, has three of the upper front teeth missing, very light moustache and little beard, the left eye is sore, and is aged about 27 years. The owner will call and claim his property according to law. MIGUEL HERNANDEZ, JR., Keeper of City Police Jail. Registered January 3, 1862. E. DEVENPORT, Clerk of Comptroller. ja4 15t

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
